thread.title: Ground News - US targets flow of Iranian funds to Yemen’s Houthis over attacks
thread.title_full: Ground News - US targets flow of Iranian funds to Yemen’s Houthis over attacks

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - US targets flow of Iranian funds to Yemen’s Houthis over attacks
text:
Summary by Ground News Two of the exchange houses are based in Yemen and one is in Turkey. The sanctions freeze any U.S. assets belonging to the targeted entities. The Houthis have seized or attacked with drones and missiles a dozen ships since Nov. 19. The Iran-aligned movement says it will continue the attacks in response to the Israeli assault on Gaza. Share menu More
Filters 3 Articles 3 Articles All Left Center Right
The Daily Caller Right Mixed Factuality Individual: Tucker Carlson Individual: Neil Patel US Sanctions Firms Funding Iranian-Backed Houthi Attacks In Red Sea Treasury placed sanctions on one individual and three exchange houses thought to be financing the recent Houthi rebel attacks disrupting trade in the Red Sea.

2 hours ago · Washington, United States Read Full Article WTVB Center Media Conglomerate: Midwest Communications US targets flow of Iranian funds to Yemen’s Houthis over attacks By Jonathan Landay WASHINGTON (Reuters) -In its latest response to attacks on shipping by the Houthis, the U.S. on Thursday sanctioned an individual and three currency exchange houses it accused of facilitating the flow of Iranian financial assistance to the Yemeni movement. Two of the exchange houses are based in Yemen and one is in Turkey, the U.S. Treasury Department said in a statement announcing the new measures. "Today's action underscores…
